et: Middle English, from Old English {it}oxa{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}ohso{/it} ox, Sanskrit {it}ukṣā{/it} bull, and perhaps to Sanskrit {it}ukṣati{/it} he moistens, Greek {it}hygros{/it} wet {ma}{mat|humor:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: a domestic bovine mammal (Bos taurus); broadly : a bovine mammal
an adult castrated male domestic ox

dt: {bc}a heavyset, shaggy-coated, {d_link|bovid|bovid} mammal ({it}Ovibos moschatus{/it}) of tundra regions of Greenland, Canada, and Alaska with the males producing a strong musky odor from glands beneath the eyes

shortdef: a heavyset, shaggy-coated, bovid mammal (Ovibos moschatus) of tundra regions of Greenland, Canada, and Alaska with the males producing a strong musky odor from glands beneath the eyes
